alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 31 at 6:11PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Alabama, including the following counties, Coffee, Dale and Houston. * WHEN...Until 815 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 611 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Daleville, Enterprise, Fort Novosel, Dothan, Midland City, Level Plains, Newton, New Brockton, Pinckard, Clayhatchee, Cairns Aaf, Gerald, Knox Field, Lowe Army Heliport, Coppinville, Keyton, Kelly, Power Dam Road, Cool Springs and Hanchey Field. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
